description:
Provide professional nursing care to residents in accordance with their individual resident required medical plans. Practice professional nursing care under the following RHRA programs; medication administration programs, fall management program, continence management program, responsive behavior management program, admission process, infection prevention program, quality assurance program. Supervise and delivers direct resident care. Establish nursing care plans based on recognized nursing assessments promoting best practices.
Key Responsibilities:

 Admit resident, assess, plan, implement and evaluate individualized care to meet the residents' physical and emotional needs. Ensure resident care plan is developed in collaboration with other members of the services team.
 Communicate with residents and/or substitute decisions maker regarding the care and condition of respective residents as required
 Assists the Director of Care by participating in discharge planning, consultation, care conferences and/or transfer of residents
 Provide direct resident care and participate in resident teaching
 Encourage active participation by residents in all therapy programs and recreational activities
 Liaise with attending physicians, psychiatrists, consultants, social workers, clergy, relatives or responsible persons to ensure effective resident care is provided
 Practice ensuring compliance to standards of resident care in retirement home
 Participates as a member of the care team and provides support to the other members of the Services team
 Assist with setting goals and annual objectives for the Home
 Assign and/ or direct care staff according to Home policy. Delegate responsibilities to appropriately qualified staff as required
 Responsible to the well-being of the residents ensuring that care and service delivery is done in accordance with the plan of care, MARS, and job routine
 Provide leadership and supervision to ensure that all work performed is conducted in a safe manner and complies with occupational health and safety policies
 Supervise and assist non-professional staff. Lead / Participate in shift report, record significant changes in residents' condition, care plan and changes in physician's orders. Reviews residents' charts, ensuring that all requirements are promptly acted upon. As required, notify physicians of change in residents' condition
 Provides first aid to staff when necessary and completes Employee Injury Report
 Administer medications, and perform medication administration program related duties
 Participate in the orientation, on-the-job training and in-servicing of care staff as required
 Any other related duties as assigned, or evidently required

Other:

 Is responsible for her/his own actions.
 Is responsible for maintaining and upgrading her/his competence related to the clinical practice and professional responsibility.
 Is aware of employees and supervisor’s responsibilities and follows all health and safety policies and procedures;
 Works safely to reduce the risk of injury to self, co-workers, guests and residents;
 Is alert to, remedies, and promptly reports all actual or potentially hazardous situations.
 All other related duties as assigned

Qualifications:

 A sound knowledge and background in seniors retirement housing including activation, nursing and personnel care administration
 Knowledge of the appropriate sections of the Health Disciplines Act, Occupational Health and Safety Act, Pharmacy Act, Food and Drugs Act (Canada), Narcotic Control Act (Canada) and other pertinent Federal, Provincial and Municipal Statutes which influence the operation of the Retirement Home and more specifically the care department
 Possess current certificate of competence with the College of Nurses of Ontario
 First Aid Certified – maintained current
 CPR certified – maintained current
 Must be able to stand for extended periods of time as well as lift heavy items

Job Type: Part-time
Salary: From $27.00 per hour
Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Evening shift
 Night shift

Licence/Certification:

 LPN/RPN (required)

Work Location: In person
